title: Have Peru's band of holes near the Nazca Plateau been explained as to their origin or purpose? - Quora

response.answer_text: I went to fly over the Nazca lines in 2016 : there is at the airport a small museum explaining things. You can buy books about the person who did investigate it. Maria Reiche - Wikipedia I also had your fascination with these constructions/artefacts/treasures who stand the “test-of-time” already 2000 years and it was a great moment during my Peru trip to see signs of intelligence in that place. I guess every person working in engineering, computer science, STEM in general, could do the trip to Nazca like a pilgrimage.
I guess you mean Nasca lines. Those are not holes! There are theories; some stupid (V.G., involving space aliens) and ohters scientifics.
You can get more information in National Geographic. The purpose was for irrigation, and harvest ceremonies.
